intro: Lepidaploa polypleura, commonly known as the broad-leafed dandelion, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of broad, heart-shaped leaves and bright yellow composite flowers that bloom in spring. The plant is native to southern Africa and thrives in dry, open habitats. It has a taproot system and produces achenes with pappus for wind dispersal. The leaves are often hairy and have a slightly bitter taste.
